page.title: 07The Severn Valley Railway
page.content: The Severn Valley line was built between 1858 and 1862 and linked Hartlebury, near Droitwich, with Shrewsbury, a distance of 40 miles away. The important stations on the route were Bewdley, Arley, Highley, Hampton Loade, Bridgnorth, Coalport, Ironbridge and Berrington. The line was used mainly for the transport of coal. It was shipped from Alveley and distributed along the line. Unfortunately passenger trains were quite rare and the development of the motor car in the 1930's spelt disaster for passenger trains. The line was closed through lack of trade in 1963, A few passenger services remained from Alveley to Kiderminster, but these were discontinued on 1969. The line was again opened in 1970 from Bridgnorth to Hampton Loade, then later extended to Bewdley.
